segment.source: This topic shows how to create a protected thread context before creating network connections in an enterprise data protection (EDP) scenario.
segment.target: This topic shows how to create a protected thread context before creating network connections in an enterprise data protection (EDP) scenario.

segment.source: Tagging network connections with EDP identity
segment.target: Tagging network connections with EDP identity

segment.source: Tagging network connections with EDP identity
segment.target: Tagging network connections with EDP identity

segment.source: Note Enterprise data protection (EDP) policy cannot be applied on Windows 10, Version 1511 (build 10586) or earlier.
segment.target: Note Enterprise data protection (EDP) policy cannot be applied on Windows 10, Version 1511 (build 10586) or earlier.

segment.source: This topic shows how to create a protected thread context before creating network connections in an enterprise data protection (EDP) scenario.
segment.target: This topic shows how to create a protected thread context before creating network connections in an enterprise data protection (EDP) scenario.

segment.source: For the full developer picture of how EDP relates to files, streams, the clipboard, networking, background tasks, and data protection under lock, see enterprise data protection (EDP).
segment.target: For the full developer picture of how EDP relates to files, streams, the clipboard, networking, background tasks, and data protection under lock, see enterprise data protection (EDP).

segment.source: Note The enterprise data protection (EDP) sample covers many EDP scenarios.
segment.target: Note The enterprise data protection (EDP) sample covers many EDP scenarios.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Get set up for EDP
segment.target: Get set up for EDP

segment.source: See Set up your computer for EDP.
segment.target: See Set up your computer for EDP.

segment.source: Commit to building an enterprise-enlightened app
segment.target: Commit to building an enterprise-enlightened app

segment.source: An app that autonomously ensures that enterprise data stays under the managing enterprise’s control is known as an enterprise-enlightened app.
segment.target: An app that autonomously ensures that enterprise data stays under the managing enterprise’s control is known as an enterprise-enlightened app.

segment.source: An enlightened app is more powerful, smart, flexible, and trusted than an unenlightened one.
segment.target: An enlightened app is more powerful, smart, flexible, and trusted than an unenlightened one.

segment.source: Your app announces to the system that it is enlightened by declaring the restricted enterpriseDataPolicy capability.
segment.target: Your app announces to the system that it is enlightened by declaring the restricted enterpriseDataPolicy capability.

segment.source: There's more to being enlightened than setting a capability, though.
segment.target: There's more to being enlightened than setting a capability, though.

segment.source: To learn more, see Enterprise-enlightened apps.
segment.target: To learn more, see Enterprise-enlightened apps.

segment.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: To learn about how to write asynchronous apps in C or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C or Visual Basic.
segment.target: To learn about how to write asynchronous apps in C or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C or Visual Basic.

segment.source: To learn about how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.
segment.target: To learn about how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.

segment.source: Accessing enterprise resources over the network
segment.target: Accessing enterprise resources over the network

segment.source: In this scenario, an enlightened mail app is synchronizing a set of mailboxes that are a mixture of both enterprise and personal mailboxes.
segment.target: In this scenario, an enlightened mail app is synchronizing a set of mailboxes that are a mixture of both enterprise and personal mailboxes.

segment.source: The app passes the user's identity to a call to ProtectionPolicyManager.CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext to create a protected thread context.
segment.target: The app passes the user's identity to a call to ProtectionPolicyManager.CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext to create a protected thread context.

segment.source: This tags all network connections that are made subsequently on the same thread with that identity, and allows access to enterprise network resources that are access-controlled by the enterprise’s policy.
segment.target: This tags all network connections that are made subsequently on the same thread with that identity, and allows access to enterprise network resources that are access-controlled by the enterprise’s policy.

segment.source: Here, "the enterprise" refers to the enterprise that the user identity belongs to.
segment.target: Here, "the enterprise" refers to the enterprise that the user identity belongs to.

segment.source: CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext returns a ThreadNetworkContext object irrespective of policy enforcement.
segment.target: CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext returns a ThreadNetworkContext object irrespective of policy enforcement.

segment.source: Generally, if the app expects to handle mixed resources, it can choose to call CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext for all identities.
segment.target: Generally, if the app expects to handle mixed resources, it can choose to call CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext for all identities.

segment.source: After retrieving network resources, the app calls Dispose on the ThreadNetworkContext to clear any identity tag from the current thread.
segment.target: After retrieving network resources, the app calls Dispose on the ThreadNetworkContext to clear any identity tag from the current thread.

segment.source: The pattern you use for disposing the context object will depend on your programming language.
segment.target: The pattern you use for disposing the context object will depend on your programming language.

segment.source: If the identity is unknown, the app can query the enterprise-policy-managed identity from the network address of the resource using the ProtectionPolicyManager.GetPrimaryManagedIdentityForNetworkEndpointAsync API.
segment.target: If the identity is unknown, the app can query the enterprise-policy-managed identity from the network address of the resource using the ProtectionPolicyManager.GetPrimaryManagedIdentityForNetworkEndpointAsync API.

segment.source: Note As you can see in the code example, the correct usage pattern for CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext is to keep to a minimum the scope in which it is in effect.
segment.target: Note As you can see in the code example, the correct usage pattern for CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext is to keep to a minimum the scope in which it is in effect.

segment.source: You should set enterprise network context, create network connections, then revert the context, use the connections and then close them.
segment.target: You should set enterprise network context, create network connections, then revert the context, use the connections and then close them.

segment.source: The code example below illustrates the details.
segment.target: The code example below illustrates the details.

segment.source: It is important that you not create files on a thread while enterprise network context is set on that thread.
segment.target: It is important that you not create files on a thread while enterprise network context is set on that thread.

segment.source: Doing so will cause the file to be automatically encrypted regardless of whether your intention is for the file to be personal.
segment.target: Doing so will cause the file to be automatically encrypted regardless of whether your intention is for the file to be personal.

segment.source: This is one of the reasons we recommend reverting the context as early as possible.
segment.target: This is one of the reasons we recommend reverting the context as early as possible.

segment.source: Note This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: Note This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
segment.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
